action.action-desc: Mrs. Dingell (for herself, Mr. Fitzpatrick, and Ms. Kuster) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to ban the use of intentionally added perfluoroalkyl or polyfluoroalkyl substances in cosmetics, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No PFAS in Cosmetics Act.

section.header: Ban on perfluoroalkyl or polyfluoroalkyl substances

subsection.text: Section 601 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 361) is amended by adding after paragraph (g) (as added by section 3503(a)(2) of division FF of Public Law 117–328) the following:

paragraph.text: If it contains an intentionally added perfluoroalkyl or polyfluoroalkyl substance.

subparagraph.text: The term perfluoroalkyl or polyfluoroalkyl substance means a substance in a class of fluorinated organic chemicals—

clause.text: has at least 1 fully fluorinated carbon atom.

subparagraph.text: The term intentionally added perfluoroalkyl or polyfluoroalkyl substance means a perfluoroalkyl or polyfluoroalkyl substance that—

clause.text: has been intentionally added by a manufacturer or supplier to an ingredient, raw material, product, or packaging and has a functional or technical effect on the product or packaging; or
is an intentional breakdown product of an added chemical.

subsection.text: Section 601(h) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, as added by subsection (a), shall apply beginning on January 1, 2025.
Section 3506 of the Modernization of Cosmetics Regulation Act of 2022 (subtitle E of title III of division FF of Public Law 117–328) is hereby repealed.
